Perhaps I am not being clear.=C2=A0 I am not asking how it works.=C2=A0 I a=
m asking what you claim it does.

For example, from your statements below, =
I get:

"The Frank's box allows entities to use FM and AM radio broadcast a=
s raw material, which these enties select and shape to communicate with the=
 user.=C2=A0 The messages received are for the user, and rarely does anyone=
 hear the same thing as the original listener."

Can you be any more specif=
ic as to what you mean by 'entities'?
Also, can the user be defined as the =
person asking the box questions?




--- On Thu, 1/7/10, Frank Sumption <pu=
rplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@gmai=
l.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] What does it do?
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
Date: Thursday, January 7, 2010, 9:35 AM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
=
      
      =C2=A0It's a freaking radio!=C2=A0 The tuning is swept across =
the entire band, AM or FM, the resulting bits of speech, music, and noise a=
re used by the enitites as a raw material to build their voices from. The s=
weep can be linear, random, or manual, and it does not have to cover the en=
tire broadcast band. This is one method and device for providing the raw au=
dio, and if you're tesitng to see if it's just broadcast fragments, conside=
r this-the concept is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker runs on a computer, th=
e entities manipulate that raw audio inside the conmputer, and if you think=
 stray RF=C2=A0is going to get inside the hard drive and mix with=C2=A0the =
audio file you have no clue how any technology works. 

=C2=A0
=C2=A0Testin=
g is irrelavent! It's not the device, it's the user. The messages received =
are for the user, and rarely does anyone hear the same thing as the origina=
l listener. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=C2=A0You test it by use, you judge it by what c=
omes through and what it means to you, you can't play the sound snipets to =
a panel of numbnuts(objective listeners)) and expect to get an unbiased/hon=
est test. No two people hear the same, so an "objective listener" is an ins=
ult to most people doing this work.

=C2=A0
=C2=A0I know, I'm being harsh.
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Frank-S


On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 8:20 AM, rasterer <rasterer@y=
ahoo. com> wrote:


=C2=A0 




Hey all, I've seen lots of people posting t=
heir perspectives and results and such about the Frank's Box. In order to h=
elp develop some good testing for it, I think the first step is to get a co=
mmon or official consensus or statement on what it is the Frank's Box is cl=
aiming to be doing. This might seem a silly question, but I think it's impo=
rtant to make sure any testing doesn't go off in some irrevelevant directio=
n.


Frank - or anyone - what is a good official statement on what the Fran=
k's box can do?
